title: How to Decorate a School Locker for a Birthday

steps.headline: Ask your school about rules for locker decorating.
steps.description: You wouldn't want to start decorating just to find out that it's forbidden. Are you only allowed to decorate the outside of your friend's locker? Only the inside? Find out about all rules so that you can't get into trouble.

steps.headline: Make sure you've got the right locker number and the right day.
steps.description: These would be big mistakes if these were not correct.

steps.headline: Discuss the plan with some other friends.
steps.description: You could do this by yourself, but the more the merrier! Plan out when you will decorate the locker,(before school, between classes, etc.) and what supplies you will need.

steps.headline: Meet at the allotted time, and start your decorating.
steps.description: This would probably after or before school.

steps.headline: Cover the locker with wrapping paper!
steps.description: Add ribbons, pictures and other things you know your friend likes! Be sure to use bright happy wrapping paper because remember, it's their special day! Also don't forget tape.

steps.headline: Decide if you want to be at the locker when your friend arrives.
steps.description: Just remember that if you aren't there, it will keep the friend in suspense as to who decorated the locker. If you are at the locker, the surprise might be ruined, because your friend will see the crowd.

steps.headline: Make signs on your computer and print them out.
Tape candy to their locker (or leave it on the floor next to their locker).
Make a lot so that your friends locker is almost completely covered.
steps.description: You might also want to just put colorful sticky notes on it for brightness.

steps.headline: When your friend comes by, try to act as natural as you could.
steps.description: When your friend opens their locker, hopefully they will be happy.
